intro: Arabis dacotica, commonly known as the rock白菜 or winter cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous or alpine environments. The plant features basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers in clusters. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy species. The seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing the plant to colonize new areas effectively.
